intro: Apium larranagum, commonly known as the Larranagum cowparade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery. The plant features finely divided, aromatic leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbels. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
